html: #CA25 just spent the most deadly fire season in California's history wondering if our communities would be safe -- and not all of them were. Climate change is an immediate issue of human health and national security. That's why I'm supporting #HR9, the Climate Action Now Act.
text:
#CA25 just spent the most deadly fire season in California's history wondering if our communities would be safe -- and not all of them were. Climate change is an immediate issue of human health and national security.

That's why I'm supporting #HR9, the Climate Action Now Act.

html: Q: Pineapple on pizza? A: I’m a believer in individual liberties, but personally — I’m a cheese and sausage fan.
text:
Q: Pineapple on pizza?

A: I’m a believer in individual liberties, but personally — I’m a cheese and sausage fan.

html: I have to say, hearing @RepKatieHill and @AsmChristySmith discuss the issues we're facing, and what's being done about them, gives me more hope for the future than I've had in a long time. Seriously, fighting back tears of joy.
text: I have to say, hearing @RepKatieHill and @AsmChristySmith discuss the issues we're facing, and what's being done about them, gives me more hope for the future than I've had in a long time. Seriously, fighting back tears of joy.

html: Q: What are you doing to address gun violence? A: I’m a cosponsor of #HR8 and we are passing universal background check legislation in the House, soon. This should be a bipartisan issue and our colleagues on the Senate side should take this onto the floor, as well.
text:
Q: What are you doing to address gun violence?

A: I’m a cosponsor of #HR8 and we are passing universal background check legislation in the House, soon. This should be a bipartisan issue and our colleagues on the Senate side should take this onto the floor, as well.

html: Q: Would you support legislation that makes English the primary language in the US? A: No.
text:
Q: Would you support legislation that makes English the primary language in the US?

A: No.

html: Q: What is the status of separated families and what are you doing about it? A: I’m deeply troubled by the lack of transparency on this issue — I’m proud that @OversightDems is looking into this issue and I will keep you posted as we learn the truth.
text:
Q: What is the status of separated families and what are you doing about it?

A: I’m deeply troubled by the lack of transparency on this issue — I’m proud that @OversightDems is looking into this issue and I will keep you posted as we learn the truth.

html: Q: What do we do about housing affordability? A: When people can’t buy houses, it puts pressure on the rental market — especially for my generation. On the fed level, we need to incentivize buying homes and make sure tax credits support middle class families and not big corps.
text:
Q: What do we do about housing affordability?

A: When people can’t buy houses, it puts pressure on the rental market — especially for my generation. On the fed level, we need to incentivize buying homes and make sure tax credits support middle class families and not big corps.

This government spending bill is a path forward that will increase border security and keep our government open.

I’ve said from the beginning that neither side would be totally happy — and that’s true, but that’s compromise.

We’ve done our jobs. @realDonaldTrump, do yours.

html: Tonight, I voted in favor of the bipartisan, bicameral government spending bill. It's not perfect, it is a compromise that will responsibly fund the government and keep it working #ForThePeople. Our constituents sent us here to work together, and that is what we have done.
text:
Tonight, I voted in favor of the bipartisan, bicameral government spending bill. It's not perfect, it is a compromise that will responsibly fund the government and keep it working #ForThePeople.

Our constituents sent us here to work together, and that is what we have done.

html: Q: We control the House, but the House & Senate have to work together. The Senate can overturn a veto with a 2/3 maj. What is the best path forward? A: Public pressure. We need people to make phone calls, especially from people in states with vulnerable Senators. Be loud.
text:
Q: We control the House, but the House & Senate have to work together. The Senate can overturn a veto with a 2/3 maj. What is the best path forward? 

A: Public pressure. We need people to make phone calls, especially from people in states with vulnerable Senators. Be loud.

html: Q: Will we continue receiving Social Security benefits? A: Yes, Social Security services and offices will remain fully operational.
text:
Q: Will we continue receiving Social Security benefits? 

A: Yes, Social Security services and offices will remain fully operational.

html: Katie and our panel are now taking questions from the audience. Q: Will we continue receiving Veterans’ benefits? A: Yes, thankfully, the VA is funded separately.
text:
Katie and our panel are now taking questions from the audience. 

Q: Will we continue receiving Veterans’ benefits? 

A: Yes, thankfully, the VA is funded separately.

html: Katie: “Not only am I willing to give more funding to border security — I want to. I want to fund the process of legal immigration so that casework doesn’t take years and I want to ensure that this country is as safe as possible.”
text: Katie: “Not only am I willing to give more funding to border security — I want to. I want to fund the process of legal immigration so that casework doesn’t take years and I want to ensure that this country is as safe as possible.”

html: Katie: “I know from my time in non-profit work that the best way to address a problem is through proper casework. That means we need as many workers as possible doing intake for asylum seekers so that the immigration process is effective & lets in people who want to work.”
text: Katie: “I know from my time in non-profit work that the best way to address a problem is through proper casework. That means we need as many workers as possible doing intake for asylum seekers so that the immigration process is effective & lets in people who want to work.”

html: I’m excited to get sworn in today. You have worked so hard for this — I am so ready for the opportunity to serve you. Now, let’s get to work. Our first order of business is to reopen the government. Out of the frying pan and into the fire, let’s go! pic.twitter.com/QyKB2EiPdK
text:
I’m excited to get sworn in today. You have worked so hard for this — I am so ready for the opportunity to serve you. Now, let’s get to work.

Our first order of business is to reopen the government. Out of the frying pan and into the fire, let’s go! pic.twitter.com/QyKB2EiPdK

html: It’s a big day and to celebrate, I wanted to share this moment with you from yesterday — this is the first time I tried to open our new office! If you want to watch swearing in today, it’s going live on C-SPAN at 12pm EST (9am PST). Let’s get to work.pic.twitter.com/1svh7cSM2H – at Longworth House Office Building

html: Got the keys, got the office — now we’ve just got to make it feel like ours! I’m figuring out what we should bring out from #CA25 so that everyone who visits our DC office knows exactly where we’re from and who we’re here for — any suggestions?pic.twitter.com/LDbYHSicYY – at Longworth House Office Building

html: I ran for office to ensure our government delivers for us — that's a promise I take seriously. We're finalizing our staff & offices so we can hit the ground running on day one. I get sworn in on Jan 3 & you can count on our team to be ready to provide the needed services to #CA25

html: Our communities sent me and my fellow Members-elect to Washington with a call to action – get dark money out of politics, clean up corruption, and make sure every vote and every voice is heard. Let's make good on that promise. #ForThePeoplepic.twitter.com/0h5db7QVUx
text: Our communities sent me and my fellow Members-elect to Washington with a call to action – get dark money out of politics, clean up corruption, and make sure every vote and every voice is heard. Let's make good on that promise. #ForThePeoplepic.twitter.com/0h5db7QVUx

html: After the devastating fires in California, our communities need relief and they need it now. It’s unusual for Members-elect to make federal requests before inauguration, but we promised our communities that we would start fighting for them on day one. That’s what we’re doing.pic.twitter.com/A6fxMwfT8T
text:
After the devastating fires in California, our communities need relief and they need it now.

It’s unusual for Members-elect to make federal requests before inauguration, but we promised our communities that we would start fighting for them on day one. That’s what we’re doing.pic.twitter.com/A6fxMwfT8T

html: Incoming @RepKatieHill is committed to delivering #ForThePeople all across the country – and that starts with restoring the promise of our democracy.pic.twitter.com/aWiSKkXBM1

html: First tweet on this account is a big one – I got to deliver the first Dem Weekly Address of the 116th Congress. Our freshman class is larger, younger & more diverse than ever before. People want change & they want it now, which is why I strongly support H.R.1. Let's get to work.pic.twitter.com/0ThofuApH5
